description:
Dissoconium aciculare CBS 342.82 is a fungal species that belongs to the genus Dissoconium. The genus Dissoconium is a member of the Ascomycota phylum, which includes fungi that produce spores within specialized structures called asci.

Dissoconium aciculare is a dematiaceous hyphomycete, meaning it produces dark-colored, septate (divided by cross-walls) hyphae. The specific epithet "aciculare" refers to the needle-like or acicular shape of the conidiophores (specialized reproductive structures that produce asexual spores called conidia).

The strain CBS 342.82 was isolated from an unknown substrate and is maintained in the Centraalbureau voor Schimmelcultures (CBS) culture collection, which is a major international repository of fungal strains.

Further details about the morphological characteristics, growth requirements, ecological roles, and potential applications of this particular strain would require additional research and information from specialized scientific sources.
